popular.recipe: In a bowl, whisk 4 large egg yolks and 1/2 cup of sugar until pale and thick. Fold in 1 cup of mascarpone cheese until smooth. In a separate bowl, whip 1 cup of heavy cream until stiff peaks form, then gently fold it into the mascarpone mixture. Dip ladyfinger biscuits into 1 cup of brewed espresso mixed with 2 tablespoons of coffee liqueur. Layer the soaked biscuits and mascarpone mixture in a dish, ending with the cream layer. Dust the top with cocoa powder and refrigerate for at least 4 hours before serving.

Preheat the oven to 175°C (350°F). Crush 200g of graham crackers and mix with 1/4 cup of melted butter. Press the mixture into a springform pan to form the crust. In a bowl, beat 3 packages of cream cheese with 3/4 cup of sugar until smooth. Add 3 large eggs, one at a time, and mix in 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract. Pour the batter over the crust and bake for 50-60 minutes, or until the center is slightly jiggly. Cool completely, then refrigerate for at least 4 hours. Serve with fruit topping if desired.

Preheat the oven to 175°C (350°F). Melt 1/2 cup of butter and 1 cup of semi-sweet chocolate chips in a saucepan. Remove from heat and stir in 1 cup of sugar, 2 large eggs, and 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract. Mix in 3/4 cup of flour, 1/4 cup of cocoa powder, and a pinch of salt. Pour the batter into a greased baking dish and bake for 25-30 minutes. Let cool before cutting into squares.

Preheat the oven to 150°C (300°F). In a saucepan, heat 2 cups of heavy cream with 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract until just steaming. In a bowl, whisk 4 large egg yolks with 1/2 cup of sugar until pale. Gradually whisk the hot cream into the egg mixture. Pour into ramekins and place them in a baking dish. Add hot water to the dish, reaching halfway up the ramekins. Bake for 40-45 minutes, or until the custard is set. Cool and refrigerate for 2 hours. Before serving, sprinkle sugar on top and caramelize with a kitchen torch.

In a saucepan, heat 2 cups of heavy cream with 1/4 cup of sugar and 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract until just steaming. In a small bowl, dissolve 1 envelope of gelatin in 3 tablespoons of cold water. Add the gelatin to the cream mixture and stir until dissolved. Pour into ramekins or glasses and refrigerate for at least 4 hours, or until set. Serve with fruit compote or fresh berries.

Crush 200g of digestive biscuits and mix with 1/4 cup of melted butter. Press the mixture into a pie dish to form the crust. Spread 1 cup of dulce de leche over the crust. Slice 3 bananas and layer them over the dulce de leche. Top with 2 cups of whipped cream and sprinkle with grated chocolate. Chill for at least 1 hour before serving.

Preheat the oven to 220°C (425°F). Grease 4 ramekins and dust them with cocoa powder. Melt 1/2 cup of butter and 1 cup of semi-sweet chocolate chips in a saucepan. In a bowl, whisk together 2 large eggs, 2 egg yolks, and 1/2 cup of sugar until pale. Fold in the chocolate mixture and 1/4 cup of flour. Divide the batter among the ramekins and bake for 10-12 minutes. The edges should be firm, but the center will be soft. Let cool for 1 minute, then invert onto plates and serve immediately.

Prepare the tart crust by mixing 1 1/2 cups of flour, 1/2 cup of cold butter, 1/4 cup of sugar, and a pinch of salt until crumbly. Press into a tart pan and bake at 180°C (350°F) for 15 minutes. Cool completely. For the filling, mix 1 cup of cream cheese, 1/2 cup of powdered sugar, and 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract until smooth. Spread the filling over the crust and top with sliced fresh fruits like berries, kiwi, and mango. Glaze with melted apricot jam if desired.

Preheat the oven to 200°C (400°F). In a saucepan, bring 1/2 cup of water, 1/4 cup of butter, and a pinch of salt to a boil. Remove from heat and stir in 1/2 cup of flour. Return to heat and stir until a ball forms. Cool slightly, then beat in 2 eggs, one at a time. Pipe or spoon onto a baking sheet and bake for 20-25 minutes. Cool, then fill with whipped cream and drizzle with melted chocolate.

Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F). Peel and slice 4 apples, then mix with 2 tablespoons of sugar and 1 teaspoon of cinnamon. Spread in a baking dish. In a bowl, combine 1/2 cup of flour, 1/2 cup of oats, 1/4 cup of brown sugar, and 1/4 cup of melted butter. Sprinkle over the apples. Bake for 30-35 minutes, or until golden brown and bubbling. Serve warm with ice cream.

In a saucepan, combine 1/2 cup of rice, 4 cups of milk, 1/4 cup of sugar, and 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract. Cook over low heat, stirring occasionally, for 30-40 minutes, or until the rice is tender and the mixture is creamy. Serve warm or chilled, topped with cinnamon or raisins if desired.

Preheat the oven to 175°C (350°F). In a bowl, mix 2 cups of flour, 2 teaspoons of baking soda, 1 teaspoon of cinnamon, and a pinch of salt. In another bowl, whisk 1 cup of sugar, 1/2 cup of oil, and 2 eggs. Add 2 cups of grated carrots and mix. Gradually combine the dry ingredients. Pour into a greased pan and bake for 40-50 minutes. Let cool and top with cream cheese frosting.

In a saucepan, heat 1/2 cup of heavy cream until steaming. Remove from heat and stir in 1 cup of chopped dark chocolate until smooth. Chill the mixture for 2 hours. Scoop into small balls and roll in cocoa powder, chopped nuts, or sprinkles. Refrigerate until firm.

Cook 1 cup of glutinous rice according to package instructions. In a saucepan, heat 1 cup of coconut milk with 1/4 cup of sugar and a pinch of salt until dissolved. Mix half the coconut milk into the rice. Serve the rice topped with fresh mango slices and drizzle with the remaining coconut milk. Sprinkle with sesame seeds if desired.

Preheat the oven to 175°C (350°F). Combine 1 1/2 cups of crushed graham crackers with 1/4 cup of melted butter and press into a pie pan. In a bowl, mix 3 egg yolks, 1 can of sweetened condensed milk, and 1/2 cup of key lime juice. Pour into the crust and bake for 15 minutes. Chill for at least 2 hours before serving. Top with whipped cream.

Preheat the oven to 200°C (400°F). Prepare the choux pastry as for profiteroles, then pipe it into long shapes on a baking sheet. Bake for 20-25 minutes and let cool. Fill with pastry cream or whipped cream, then top with melted chocolate. Chill before serving.

cookies.recipe: Preheat the oven to 175°C (350°F). In a bowl, cream together 1 cup of softened butter, 1 cup of brown sugar, and 1/2 cup of granulated sugar until fluffy. Mix in 2 large eggs and 2 teaspoons of vanilla extract. In another bowl, whisk together 2 1/4 cups of flour, 1 teaspoon of baking soda, and 1/2 teaspoon of salt. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients. Fold in 2 cups of semi-sweet chocolate chips. Drop spoonfuls of dough onto a lined baking sheet and bake for 10-12 minutes, or until golden. Cool on a wire rack.

Preheat the oven to 175°C (350°F). In a large bowl, cream together 3/4 cup of softened butter, 3/4 cup of brown sugar, and 1/2 cup of granulated sugar until smooth. Beat in 2 eggs and 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract. In another bowl, combine 1 1/2 cups of flour, 1 teaspoon of baking soda, 1 teaspoon of cinnamon, and 1/2 teaspoon of salt. Gradually mix the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients. Stir in 3 cups of rolled oats and 1 cup of raisins. Drop spoonfuls of dough onto a lined baking sheet and bake for 10-12 minutes. Let cool on a wire rack.

Preheat the oven to 175°C (350°F). In a bowl, beat together 1/2 cup of softened butter, 1/2 cup of peanut butter, 1/2 cup of granulated sugar, and 1/2 cup of brown sugar until creamy. Add 1 egg and 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract and mix well. In a separate bowl, whisk together 1 1/4 cups of flour, 1/2 teaspoon of baking soda, and 1/4 teaspoon of salt. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients. Roll the dough into balls and place them on a lined baking sheet. Flatten each ball with a fork, creating a crisscross pattern. Bake for 10-12 minutes and cool on a wire rack.

Preheat the oven to 175°C (350°F). In a bowl, cream together 1 cup of softened butter and 1 cup of granulated sugar until smooth. Beat in 1 egg and 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract. In another bowl, combine 2 3/4 cups of flour, 1 teaspoon of baking soda, and 1/2 teaspoon of baking powder. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients. Roll the dough into balls and place them on a lined baking sheet. Flatten slightly with your hand. Sprinkle with sugar, if desired. Bake for 8-10 minutes, or until edges are lightly golden. Cool on a wire rack.

Preheat the oven to 175°C (350°F). In a bowl, cream together 1/2 cup of softened butter, 1 cup of granulated sugar, and 1/2 cup of brown sugar until fluffy. Mix in 2 large eggs and 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract. In another bowl, whisk together 1 3/4 cups of flour, 1/2 cup of cocoa powder, 1 teaspoon of baking soda, and 1/4 teaspoon of salt. Gradually combine the dry ingredients with the wet ingredients. Fold in 1 1/2 cups of chocolate chips. Drop spoonfuls of dough onto a lined baking sheet and bake for 10-12 minutes. Cool on a wire rack.

iceCreams.recipe: In a medium saucepan, heat 2 cups of heavy cream, 1 cup of whole milk, and 3/4 cup of granulated sugar over medium heat until the sugar dissolves. Remove from heat and stir in 2 teaspoons of pure vanilla extract. Let the mixture cool, then chill in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours. Pour the chilled mixture into an ice cream maker and churn according to the manufacturer's instructions. Transfer to a container and freeze for 4-6 hours before serving.

In a saucepan, combine 2 cups of heavy cream, 1 cup of whole milk, 3/4 cup of granulated sugar, and 1/2 cup of unsweetened cocoa powder. Heat over medium heat, whisking until smooth. In a separate bowl, whisk 4 large egg yolks. Slowly add a cup of the hot mixture to the yolks while whisking, then return it all to the saucepan. Cook until slightly thickened. Remove from heat and stir in 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract. Chill the mixture for 2 hours, then churn in an ice cream maker and freeze for 4-6 hours.

In a blender, puree 2 cups of fresh strawberries with 1/2 cup of sugar. In a bowl, mix 1 cup of whole milk, 2 cups of heavy cream, and the strawberry puree. Chill the mixture in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours. Pour the chilled mixture into an ice cream maker and churn according to the manufacturer's instructions. Freeze for 4-6 hours before serving.

In a saucepan, heat 2 cups of heavy cream, 1 cup of whole milk, and 3/4 cup of sugar over medium heat until the sugar dissolves. Remove from heat and stir in 1 teaspoon of peppermint extract and a few drops of green food coloring (optional). Chill the mixture in the refrigerator for 2 hours. Pour the mixture into an ice cream maker and churn according to the manufacturer's instructions. Fold in 1 cup of mini chocolate chips. Freeze for 4-6 hours before serving.

In a saucepan, heat 2 cups of heavy cream, 1 cup of whole milk, 3/4 cup of sugar, and 2 tablespoons of instant coffee granules over medium heat until the sugar and coffee dissolve. In a separate bowl, whisk 4 large egg yolks. Slowly add a cup of the hot mixture to the yolks while whisking, then return it all to the saucepan. Cook until slightly thickened. Remove from heat and let cool. Chill the mixture for 2 hours, then churn in an ice cream maker and freeze for 4-6 hours.

fried.recipe: In a saucepan, heat 1 cup of water, 1/2 cup of unsalted butter, 1 tablespoon of sugar, and a pinch of salt until boiling. Remove from heat and stir in 1 cup of flour until the mixture forms a dough. Let cool slightly, then mix in 2 large eggs, one at a time, until smooth. Heat oil in a deep fryer to 180°C (350°F). Pipe the dough into the hot oil using a star-tipped piping bag, cutting into 6-inch pieces. Fry until golden, about 2-3 minutes per side. Drain on paper towels and roll in cinnamon sugar. Serve warm.

Scoop 4 balls of ice cream and freeze them until solid. Roll the ice cream balls in crushed cornflakes, then in beaten egg, and coat again in cornflakes. Freeze the coated balls for at least 2 hours. Heat oil in a deep fryer to 190°C (375°F). Fry each ice cream ball for about 10 seconds, just until golden. Drain quickly and serve immediately with whipped cream or chocolate sauce.

In a bowl, combine 1 cup of warm milk, 1/4 cup of granulated sugar, and 2 1/4 teaspoons of active dry yeast. Let sit for 5 minutes. Add 2 large eggs, 1/3 cup of melted butter, and 4 cups of flour. Knead the dough until smooth and let rise for 1 hour. Roll out the dough and cut into donut shapes. Heat oil in a deep fryer to 180°C (350°F). Fry the donuts for 1-2 minutes per side, until golden. Drain on paper towels and glaze with your choice of icing or sprinkle with powdered sugar.

In a bowl, mix 1 cup of flour, 1/4 cup of sugar, 1 teaspoon of baking powder, and 1/4 teaspoon of salt. In another bowl, whisk together 1/3 cup of milk, 1 large egg, and 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract. Combine the wet and dry ingredients, then fold in 1 cup of diced apples. Heat oil in a deep fryer to 180°C (350°F). Drop spoonfuls of batter into the hot oil and fry until golden brown, about 2-3 minutes per side. Drain on paper towels and drizzle with glaze made from powdered sugar and milk.

In a bowl, whisk together 1 cup of pancake mix, 1 large egg, and 2/3 cup of milk to form a smooth batter. Heat oil in a deep fryer to 180°C (350°F). Dip each Oreo cookie into the batter, ensuring it is fully coated, and gently drop into the hot oil. Fry for 1-2 minutes, or until golden. Drain on paper towels and dust with powdered sugar before serving.

fruits.recipe: In a glass, layer 1 cup of low-fat Greek yogurt with 1/2 cup of mixed fresh berries (blueberries, strawberries, raspberries) and 1/4 cup of granola. Repeat the layers until the glass is full. Top with a drizzle of honey and a sprig of fresh mint if desired. Serve immediately.

Preheat the oven to 175°C (350°F). Core 4 apples, leaving the bottoms intact. Mix 1/4 cup of rolled oats, 2 tablespoons of brown sugar, 1 teaspoon of cinnamon, and 2 tablespoons of chopped nuts in a bowl. Fill each apple with the mixture and place them in a baking dish. Pour 1/2 cup of water into the dish and bake for 30-40 minutes, or until the apples are tender. Serve warm, optionally with a dollop of yogurt.

In a bowl, mix 1/4 cup of chia seeds with 1 cup of almond milk, 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract, and 1 tablespoon of maple syrup. Stir well and refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight, stirring once after the first hour. To serve, layer the chia pudding in a glass with 1/2 cup of diced fresh mango and sprinkle with shredded coconut.

Preheat the oven to 175°C (350°F). In a bowl, mash 2 ripe bananas and mix with 1 cup of rolled oats and 1/4 cup of raisins or dark chocolate chips. Scoop the mixture onto a lined baking sheet, forming small cookies. Bake for 12-15 minutes, or until set and lightly golden. Let cool on a wire rack before serving.

fruits.dish: Grilled Peaches with Honey and Yogurt
fruits.recipe: Preheat a grill or grill pan over medium heat. Cut 2 ripe peaches in half and remove the pits. Brush the cut sides with a little olive oil. Grill the peaches, cut side down, for 3-4 minutes until lightly charred. Remove from the grill and drizzle with honey. Serve each peach half with a dollop of Greek yogurt and a sprinkle of chopped almonds.
